channel.title: Skillcapes
channel.description:
Alright,
To be honest I'm quite ashamed I had to turn to this. However, I have no idea what to do now.
Anyway,
I've added the models and the ints for the Skillcapes in the client files. Plus I made sure that the Ids were correct in Item.Cfg. Therefore I don't know what else is wrong; as I can see on the client. The "Skillcapes" look like boxes though it says the name of the Skillcape.
Thanks,
Ix Soulcist xI (James)

item.title: Skillcapes
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

Look at the INT’s again.

This

if(i == 3882)

Is the item’s ID. Not the one that you set in item.cfg

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcapes
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Yeah, that would be funny. I mean, you have like 70 reps. So, getting help from a N00b like me would be hilarious.

Read full topic

item.title: Skillcapes
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

sageofmali:

When you login to your server, type “add models”. Of course without the quotes. Hopefully this helped.

If this worked then I am going to loose my mind. That is such a simple thing.

Read full topic

item.description:

Alright,

To be honest I’m quite ashamed I had to turn to this. However, I have no idea what to do now.

Anyway,

I’ve added the models and the ints for the Skillcapes in the client files. Plus I made sure that the Ids were correct in Item.Cfg. Therefore I don’t know what else is wrong; as I can see on the client. The “Skillcapes” look like boxes though it says the name of the Skillcape.

Ix Soulcist xI (James)
